page.title: 07Chemical Fertilizers
page.content: Before crops can be grown the earth is tested for it's lime content. Barley and rape need a lot of lime but wheat and potatoes not so much. If the soil needs more lime it is sprayed on the ground as granules. They're put in a hopper. Because the soil is heavy a flat lift is used.This goes deeper than a plough and lifts and lightens the earth. It does not turn it over. The pig tail cultivator is taken over a field twice to break up the earth. Fertilizer in liquid is spread over the ground and washed in by the rain. In mid June a spray containing a fungicide and pesticide is applied from a helicopter. Wheat used for milling, (i.e.for flour and bread) is given a late application of Nitrogen. This increases the protein content of the flour. Then it is combined, dried and stored until it's used.
